text: So again, how would you say I want?
Je veux.
I want to take it.
Je veux le prendre.
He wants to take it.
Il veut le prendre.
She wants to take it.
Elle veut le prendre.
She wants to take it now.
Elle veut le prendre maintenant.
You, informal, using the to form, want to take it.
Tu veux le prendre.
You, using the vous form, the formal form, you want to take it.
Vous voulez le prendre?
Do you want to take it?
Voulez-vous le prendre?
You can also ask the same question simply by placing est-ce que, meaning is it that at the beginning.
So how would you say is it that you want to take it?
Est-ce que vous voulez le prendre?
Finally, you also have the option of simply saying you want to take it.
Vous voulez le prendre?
Vous voulez le prendre?
We want to take it.
Nous voulons le prendre.
Finally, again, they want to take it.
Ils veulent le prendre.
You will have noticed, and of course it's been pointed out, that he in French is
il
and they is also il.
There is a difference in spelling.
He is spelt I-L, but they is spelt I-L-S.
Of course, as we mentioned earlier, and according to the for luck rule, a consonant at the end
of a word is not pronounced unless it's in for luck.
So the S at the end of il is not pronounced, which is why he and they sound the same.
In addition to using il for they, there is also a feminine form for they, which is
elle, which of course sounds exactly the same as she, which is also elle.
The feminine form is used when referring to an entirely female group.
Most of the time in French you won't be using it, because if, for example,
you encountered a group with 99 women and just one man, you would still use il,
as this is the default form for either a male group or a mixed group.
Even if that mixed group is predominantly female, you will still use il.
However, if it's an entirely female group and you want to say, for instance,
they want to take it, how would you say that?
They want to take it, how would you say that?
And then, how would you say that?
And then, how would you say that?
And then, how would you say that?
And then, how would you say that?
And then, how would you say that?
And then, how would you say that?
And then, how would you say that?
And then, how would you say that?
And then, how would you say that?
And then, how would you say that?
